page.title: 11The Agricultural Institute
page.content: Chadacre Hall and estate were purchased in 1918 by the First Earl of Iveagh,who set up a trust fund to establish and endow an Institute for agricultural education and training.The Hall was modified and now provides a dininghall library,lecture room,chapel,recreation rooms,sports hall and group study bed- rooms as well as kitchens,offices and accomodation for resident staff.Since its first opening as Chadacre Agricult- ural Institute in 1921 a course in gen- eral agriculture has been offered,cov- ering 2 winters'residence with the in- tervening summer being spent on farms. It was originally intended to provide free training for sons of farmers and farm workers from Suffolk and adjoining counties,but under modern conditions fees have to be charged(although most students obtain generous grants) and now accept students from overseas too.
